question: Question_06_(b)
statement:
Let $\mathbb{I}$ be the set of irrational numbers. That is
$\mathbb{I}=\mathbb{R}-\mathbb{Q}$.

Decide whether the following statements are true or false. Prove your
answers. \textbf{Hint:}The results from part
\href{Science:Math_Exam_Resources/Courses/MATH220/December_2009/Question_06_(a)}{(a)}
will be of great help.

(i) $\forall{}x\in\mathbb{I},\forall{}y\in\mathbb{I},xy\in\mathbb{I}$.

(ii)
$\forall{}x\in\mathbb{I},\exists{}y\in\mathbb{I}\quad\textrm{s.t.}\quad{}xy\in\mathbb{I}$.
